title: Usability Principles
description: Match usability heuristics and concepts to their descriptions and meanings.

questions.title: Match Usability Heuristics to their Description

pairs.right: Keeping the user informed about what is happening (e.g., a progress bar).
Providing an 'undo' button or a clear 'exit' to let users easily fix mistakes.
Showing options in a menu instead of making the user remember commands.
Designing the system to make mistakes less likely, like disabling a button until a form is complete.

distractorsRight: Making the interface pretty with lots of colours and fonts.
Using technical jargon to sound more professional.

questions.title: Match Usability Concepts to their Meanings

pairs.right: When similar elements look and act the same way within a single website or app.
Designing an interface so it can be used by people with disabilities, such as screen-reader users.
Ensuring words like 'whānau' are displayed with correct spelling and macrons in the interface.
When an interface works in a way that feels familiar to users based on how other apps work.

distractorsRight: Showing a progress bar when a file is uploading.
Making sure the app is available in many different countries.
